q: FOR THE SUCCESSFUL For Weezer lead guitarist Brian Bell , performing "Say It Ain't So" in front of a live studio audience on "Late Show With David Letterman " was a surreal experience. Playing on TV for the first time when you're in your 20s, it's just bizarre, recalled Brian Bell . "There's a lot of pressure when you're young." Now, he said, performing in front of 100 people- or 15,000- feels "so natural." Weezer

the current spring in Donald Rumsfeld 's step is the resulting abandonment by Barack Obama of much of his strident opposition to President Bush 's anti-terrorism policies. Turning to Dick Cheney at CPAC, Donald Rumsfeld taunted the Left by saying: I look at the current administration's many reversals of their announced policies on national security issues- Guantanamo Bay, military commissions, indefinite detention, CIA drone strikes. "It makes me wonder if Dick Cheney has had more influence on Barack Obama than the people that got him elected. The vociferous anger of the Rand Paul supporters at CPAC indicated that Republicans remain divided over the President Bush legacy. The Paulites, however, are very much in the minority. He reads from some issued in 2003 and in 2005: Are we winning or losing the war on terror? "Is the John McCain government changing fast enough?" "Do we need more troops?
